instruction: "Can you explain how private capital provides diversification benefits and what institutional investors should consider when modeling these strategies?"
output: "Private capital strategies represent a diverse set of investment approaches that have historically provided uncorrelated returns and diversification benefits to multi-asset-class portfolios. While return premia have fluctuated over time, private capital has remained a valuable tool for many institutional investors seeking to mitigate risk and enhance returns. When modeling private capital strategies, investors should take into account factors such as correlations with other assets, potential volatility, and liquidity concerns. By carefully modeling these strategies, investors can gain greater insight into their potential role in building more diversified and robust portfolios."
